title: Seneca Falls Convention
description: The first women's rights convention is held in Seneca Falls, New York. The convention produces the Declaration of Sentiments, which sets the agenda for the women's rights movement.

title: Wyoming Territory Women's Suffrage
description: The Wyoming Territory becomes the first in the United States to grant women the right to vote.

title: New Zealand Women's Suffrage
description: New Zealand becomes the first self-governing country to grant women the right to vote.

title: Passage of the 19th Amendment in the US
description: The 19th Amendment to the United States Constitution, granting women the right to vote, is passed.

title: UN Charter
description: The United Nations Charter is signed, reaffirming faith in fundamental human rights and equal rights of men and women.

title: Abortion Act 1967
description: The United Kingdom passes the Abortion Act, making abortions legal up to 28 weeks.

title: UN International Women's Year
description: The United Nations begins celebrating International Women's Year.

title: Violence Against Women Act
description: The United States passes the Violence Against Women Act.

title: Liberia's First Female President
description: Ellen Johnson Sirleaf is sworn in as Liberia's new president. She becomes Africa's first female elected head of state.

title: United States Vice President
description: Kamala Harris becomes the first female Vice President of the United States.
